bug.author: sebastian-sosa
bug.summary: [CLI] wandb sync --id=3ry7a3m2 syncs all experiments instead of the provided one
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname
Weights and Biases version: 0.8.36 Python version: 3.7.6 Operating System: Debian 9.0
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I modified wandb-summary.json locally and want to upload my changes. I'm probably missing something from the CLI docs, but no matter what command combination I try, I keep uploading all the runs instead of just the provided one. Docs from CLI: <denchmark-code>wandb sync --help
Usage: wandb sync [OPTIONS] [PATH]...
Upload an offline training directory to W&B
Options: --id TEXT The run you want to upload to. -p, --project TEXT The project you want to upload to. -e, --entity TEXT The entity to scope to. --ignore TEXT A comma seperated list of globs to ignore syncing with wandb.
--help Show this message and exit. </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
I tried with all the following commands, and the result was always the same: wandb would upload all the runs on my local directory. There is a folder wandb and a run inside it under the folder run-20200602_150630-3ry7a3m2 from where the command was invoked. Commands I tried: <denchmark-code>wandb sync --id=3ry7a3m2 wandb sync --id=3ry7a3m2 wandb/ wandb sync --id 3ry7a3m2 wandb/ wandb sync --id=3ry7a3m2 wandb/ wandb sync --id "3ry7a3m2" wandb sync --id '3ry7a3m2' wandb sync --id '3ry7a3m2' wandb/ wandb sync --id='3ry7a3m2' wandb/ wandb sync --id="3ry7a3m2" wandb/
</denchmark-code>
Am I missing anything? Thanks, Sebastian

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.63. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
We iterate over all directories by default. You can pass the individual directory to sync only that one. i.e. wandb sync wandb/run-XXXXX-3ry7a3m2

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/sebastian-sosa>@sebastian-sosa</denchmark-link>
In the past year we've majorly reworked the CLI and UI for Weights & Biases. We're closing issues older than 6 months. Please comment to reopen.
